title: Retinomorphic Vision Systems I: Pixel Design
abstract:
I present and analyze test results from circuits that 
perform all four major operations performed by biological 
retinae using neurobiological principles: (1) continuous 
sensing for detection, (2) local automatic gain  control 
for amplification, (3) spatiotemporal bandpass filtering 
for preprocessing, and (4) adaptive sampling for 
quantization. In the retinomorphic system that I  describe, 
all these operations are performed at the pixel level, to 
eliminate redundancy, to reduce power dissipation, and 
to make efficient use of  the capacity of the output 
channel.
